chapter1.question: During which period did the Inter-testamental Period occur?

When was the canonization of the New Testament concluded?
What event marked the beginning of the New Testament period?
What event marked the end of the New Testament period?
Which ruler was appointed to oversee Palestine in AD 26-36?
Which ruler ordered the death of all the baby boys in Bethlehem after the visit of the wise men?
Who was known as the ruler of Galilee and Perea during Jesus' lifetime?
Who reigned over the southern parts of Palestine between BC 4-AD 6?
Who was responsible for the destruction of the temple in AD 70?
What is the name of the high priest mentioned in connection with Jesus' trial?
Which Jewish group adhered strictly to the Law of Moses and had a great zeal for their religion?
Who was known for their rejection of newer traditions and belief in the Torah?
What is the term used to describe the Jewish group that lived a communal lifestyle near the Dead Sea?
Which group among the Jews was strongly opposed to Roman rule?
Which group among the Jews did not believe in life after death or in angels and spirits?
What were the Essenes known for preserving?
Which geographical region was Jesus primarily active in during his ministry?
In which region did Jesus grow up and live?
Which chapter of Matthew's Gospel records the visit of the wise men from the East?
Which verse in Matthew's Gospel records Herod ordering the death of the baby boys in Bethlehem?
In which chapter of Luke's Gospel is the birth of Jesus mentioned?
What is the term used for the collection of books recognized as authoritative Scripture?
What was the primary language spoken by most Jews during the time of Jesus?

chapter2.question: What is the definition of incarnation?
chapter2.correct: God becoming human flesh

chapter2.question: According to 1 Timothy 3:16, how is the mystery of godliness described?
options: God was manifest in the flesh
chapter2.correct: God was manifest in the flesh

chapter2.question: Who is the ultimate author of the Bible?
chapter2.correct: God

chapter2.question: Which two Bible verses indicate the inspiration of the Scriptures?
chapter2.correct: 2 Peter 1:21 and 2 Timothy 3:16

chapter2.question: How does Apostle John describe the incarnation of Christ in John 1:14?
chapter2.correct: The Word became flesh

chapter2.question: What did Jesus mean when He said, 'I and my Father are one'?
options: They are one in essence and nature
chapter2.correct: They are one in essence and nature

chapter2.question: Who requested Jesus to show them the Father in John 14:8-9?
chapter2.correct: Philip

chapter2.question: What caused the fall of man according to the text?
chapter2.correct: Disobedience to God's command

chapter2.question: Which beings rebelled and were driven from heaven as noted in Isaiah 14:12-15 and Ezekiel 28:11-19?
chapter2.correct: Lucifer and his angels

chapter2.question: How did Lucifer deceive Eve?
options: By using a medium, the serpent
chapter2.correct: By using a medium, the serpent

chapter2.question: What is the ultimate solution to the fallen state of the world?
options: God's plan of redemption through Jesus Christ
chapter2.correct: God's plan of redemption through Jesus Christ

chapter2.question: When was the plan of redemption in place according to Ellen G. White?
chapter2.correct: Before the fall of man

chapter2.question: Why was the incarnation of Christ necessary?
options: To handle the problem of sin
chapter2.correct: To handle the problem of sin

chapter2.question: What role does Jesus play in paying the penalty for sin?
chapter2.correct: He becomes our substitute

chapter2.question: What does Hebrews 4:15 say about Jesus' sinlessness?
options: He was tempted in all points yet without sin
chapter2.correct: He was tempted in all points yet without sin

chapter2.question: What are the specific roles of the Trinity in the plan of redemption?
options: Each has a unique role: God the Father gives, God the Son yields, and God the Holy Spirit impresses
chapter2.correct: Each has a unique role: God the Father gives, God the Son yields, and God the Holy Spirit impresses

chapter2.question: According to John 3:16, what did God the Father give for the redemption of humanity?
chapter2.correct: His only Son

chapter2.question: How did Jesus Christ yield Himself in the plan of redemption according to Philippians 2:6-8?
options: By humbling Himself and becoming obedient unto death
chapter2.correct: By humbling Himself and becoming obedient unto death

chapter2.question: What does the term 'Emmanuel' mean?
chapter2.correct: God with us

chapter2.question: What did God promise in the protoevangelium in Genesis 3:15?
chapter2.correct: The coming of a Savior

chapter2.question: According to John 14:6, what is Jesus' role in accessing the Father?
options: He is one of many ways
He is the only way, truth, and life
He is a teacher of the way
chapter2.correct: He is the only way, truth, and life

chapter2.question: According to Romans 5:8, how does God demonstrate His love for us?
options: By Christ dying for us while we were still sinners
chapter2.correct: By Christ dying for us while we were still sinners

chapter2.question: According to 1 John 2:2, how is Jesus' atoning sacrifice described?
options: As the atonement for the sins of the whole world
chapter2.correct: As the atonement for the sins of the whole world

chapter2.question: What does Ephesians 2:8-9 describe about salvation?
options: As a result of good works
By grace through faith, not from ourselves, it is the gift of God
As a reward for the righteous
As a combination of faith and works
chapter2.correct: By grace through faith, not from ourselves, it is the gift of God

chapter2.question: What does Romans 6:23 say about the wages of sin and the gift of God?
options: The wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus
The gift of God is temporary
chapter2.correct: The wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus

He asked John to pray instead

chapter6.question: What is the pervading presence of temptation according to the text?
options: It is limited to certain places
chapter6.correct: It is encountered everywhere

chapter6.question: According to Apostle James, when are individuals tempted?
options: When they are strong in faith
When they are dragged away by evil desires
When they are surrounded by supportive people
chapter6.correct: When they are dragged away by evil desires

chapter6.question: Who reflected on James 2 in the 19th century?
chapter6.correct: Charles H. Spurgeon

chapter6.question: What did Spurgeon warn about regarding temptation?
options: Beware of yourself more than anyone else
chapter6.correct: Beware of yourself more than anyone else

chapter6.question: What is the goal of the chapter according to the text?
options: To list all the temptations Jesus faced
To examine the temptation of Christ and draw lessons
To prove that Jesus was immune to temptation
To discuss the nature of sin and temptation
chapter6.correct: To examine the temptation of Christ and draw lessons

chapter6.question: How long did Jesus fast before being tempted?
chapter6.correct: 40 days and 40 nights

chapter6.question: Why did Satan choose to tempt Jesus at that particular moment?
options: Jesus was surrounded by his disciples
Jesus was in a crowded marketplace
chapter6.correct: Jesus was weak and vulnerable

chapter6.question: What did Satan ask Jesus to do in the first temptation?
options: Jump off the pinnacle of the temple
Worship him and he would give him all the kingdoms of the world
chapter6.correct: Turn stones into bread

chapter6.question: How did Jesus respond to Satan's first temptation?
options: He rebuked Satan and quoted Scripture
chapter6.correct: He rebuked Satan and quoted Scripture

chapter6.question: What does the text say about the power of the Holy Spirit?
options: It can be manipulated for personal gain
It empowers believers to overcome temptation
It is only available to a select few
It is unreliable in times of temptation
chapter6.correct: It empowers believers to overcome temptation

chapter6.question: Who wrote the account of the temptation of Jesus in the Gospels?
chapter6.correct: Matthew and Luke

chapter6.question: What did Jesus do before the Devil came to tempt him?
chapter6.correct: He fasted and prayed

chapter6.question: How many possibilities does the text mention for how the story of the temptation of Jesus got recorded?
chapter6.correct: Three

chapter6.question: What is the first possibility mentioned for how the story got recorded?
options: Jesus told his disciples to record it
The Gospel writers were inspired by the Holy Spirit
It was a common rumor among the people
chapter6.correct: The Gospel writers were inspired by the Holy Spirit

chapter6.question: According to the text, why is the temptation of Jesus recorded in the Holy Writ?
options: To demonstrate that Jesus was immune to temptation
To show that nobody is above temptation
To prove the power of Satan
chapter6.correct: To show that nobody is above temptation

chapter6.question: What was the first temptation Jesus faced?
chapter6.correct: Appetite

chapter6.question: How did Satan tempt Jesus regarding appetite?
options: By asking him to perform miracles
By suggesting he turn stones into bread
By tempting him to worship Satan
chapter6.correct: By suggesting he turn stones into bread

chapter6.question: What did Jesus respond with when tempted regarding appetite?
options: He ran away from the temptation
chapter6.correct: He quoted Scripture

chapter6.question: What does the text say about the nature of temptation?
options: It is not synonymous with sin
chapter6.correct: It is not synonymous with sin

chapter6.question: How did Satan tempt Jesus regarding presumption?
options: By offering him power and glory
By suggesting he jump off the pinnacle of the temple
By promising him wealth and riches
By tempting him to doubt God's promises
chapter6.correct: By suggesting he jump off the pinnacle of the temple

chapter6.question: What did Satan quote to support his temptation regarding presumption?
chapter6.correct: The Psalms

chapter6.question: What did Jesus respond with when tempted regarding presumption?
options: He rebuked Satan and quoted Scripture
chapter6.correct: He rebuked Satan and quoted Scripture

chapter6.question: How did Satan tempt Jesus regarding compromise?
options: By offering him power and glory
By suggesting he jump off the pinnacle of the temple
By promising him wealth and riches
By tempting him to worship Satan
chapter6.correct: By tempting him to worship Satan

chapter6.question: What did Satan promise Jesus if he compromised?
options: Power and authority over all the kingdoms of the world
chapter6.correct: Power and authority over all the kingdoms of the world

chapter6.question: What did Jesus say in response to Satan's offer regarding compromise?
options: You shall worship the Lord your God, and him only you shall serve
I will worship you and accept your offer
chapter6.correct: You shall worship the Lord your God, and him only you shall serve

chapter7.question: How many times is the expression 'Kingdom of God' mentioned in the Synoptic tradition, according to Ayegboyin?
chapter7.correct: All of the above

chapter7.question: In the Old Testament, what is the primary meaning of the Hebrew root 'mlk'?
chapter7.correct: To rule

chapter7.question: According to Daniel 2:44, what will happen to the world kingdoms?
options: They will be destroyed by the Kingdom of God
They will unite with the Kingdom of God
They will conquer the Kingdom of God
chapter7.correct: They will be destroyed by the Kingdom of God

chapter7.question: How did the Jews perceive the Kingdom of God during the lifetime of Jesus?
options: As a political entity with Jerusalem as its center
As a future hope without any present significance
As a personal experience for each individual
chapter7.correct: As a political entity with Jerusalem as its center

chapter7.question: What did Jesus teach about the Kingdom of God during His ministry?
options: It is only a future blessing
It is a present reality experienced through repentance
It is confined to the borders of Israel
It can only be entered by Jews
chapter7.correct: It is a present reality experienced through repentance

chapter7.question: What did John the Baptist associate with the nearness of the Kingdom of God?
chapter7.correct: Repentance

chapter7.question: According to Jesus, who qualifies for citizenship in the Kingdom of God?
options: Those who accept Christ and express faith in Him
chapter7.correct: Those who accept Christ and express faith in Him

chapter7.question: What does Realized Eschatology refer to?
options: The future consummation of the Kingdom of God
The present reality of the Kingdom of God
The spiritual dimension of the Kingdom of God
The earthly aspect of the Kingdom of God
chapter7.correct: The present reality of the Kingdom of God

chapter7.question: How did Jesus demonstrate the presence of the Kingdom of God through His ministry?
options: By performing miracles and healing the sick
chapter7.correct: By performing miracles and healing the sick

chapter7.question: What are the principles for qualification and entrance into the Kingdom of God according to Jesus?
options: Spiritual rebirth and acceptance of Christ
chapter7.correct: Spiritual rebirth and acceptance of Christ

chapter7.question: Which covenant is the Davidic Messianic Kingdom centrally based in?
chapter7.correct: Abrahamic Covenant

chapter7.question: What is the central theme of the teachings of Jesus Christ in the Synoptic Gospels?
chapter7.correct: The Kingdom of Heaven/God

chapter7.question: In the Old Testament, what did the establishment of God's kingdom begin with?
chapter7.correct: The Covenant with Abraham

chapter7.question: How is the concept of the kingdom of God presented in the New Testament?
options: As both a present reality and a future hope
chapter7.correct: As both a present reality and a future hope

chapter7.question: Which book of the Old Testament is rich with kingdom matters and visions?
chapter7.correct: Daniel

chapter7.question: What does Daniel's vision of the 'Son of Man' (Daniel 7:14) describe?
chapter7.correct: An everlasting dominion

chapter7.question: According to the Old Testament, who was regarded as the true King of Israel?
chapter7.correct: God (Yahweh)

chapter7.question: How did the Jewish state govern its people from the Exodus to the conquest of Canaan?
options: By laws derived directly from heaven
By the authority of the High Priest
By the military might of the judges
chapter7.correct: By laws derived directly from heaven

chapter7.question: How did Jesus' teachings on the Kingdom of God differ from Jewish expectations?
options: Jesus taught it was only a future kingdom
Jesus emphasized its spiritual nature and universal availability
Jesus limited it to the Jewish people
chapter7.correct: Jesus emphasized its spiritual nature and universal availability

chapter7.question: According to Jesus, what is required for entrance into the Kingdom of God?
chapter7.correct: Repentance and faith

chapter7.question: How did Jesus describe the Kingdom of God in Luke 17:21?
chapter7.correct: As being 'in your midst'

chapter7.question: What does Jesus' healing ministry signify about the Kingdom of God?
options: It is limited to physical healing
It demonstrates God's power and presence
It is only for the Jewish people
chapter7.correct: It demonstrates God's power and presence

chapter7.question: What did Jesus commission His disciples to do after His resurrection?
options: Preach the gospel of the Kingdom to the world
chapter7.correct: Preach the gospel of the Kingdom to the world

chapter7.question: What marks the final consummation of the Kingdom of God?
chapter7.correct: Jesus' Second Coming

chapter7.question: How did Jesus indicate the future nature of the Kingdom during the Last Supper?
options: By saying He would drink the fruit of the vine anew in His Father's kingdom
By predicting the destruction of the temple
chapter7.correct: By saying He would drink the fruit of the vine anew in His Father's kingdom

chapter8.question: Who is considered the pioneer and perfecter of the Christian faith, mission, and ministry?
What was Jesus' primary purpose for mission and ministry?
Which of the following best describes Jesus' mission approach?
What example shows Jesus' personal mission approach?
options: Attending to the man possessed by demonic spirits
chapter8.correct: Attending to the man possessed by demonic spirits

chapter8.question: According to David Bosch, how should Jesus' life and ministry be seen?
What was Jesus' response to Jewish customs and traditions that contradicted God's precepts?
options: He adapted them to fit his teachings

chapter8.question: Which incident illustrates Jesus' countercultural approach to the Sabbath?
options: Allowing his disciples to pluck and eat on the Sabbath
chapter8.correct: Allowing his disciples to pluck and eat on the Sabbath

chapter8.question: How did Jesus adapt his message to different contexts?
options: By using the same message for everyone
By varying his message based on the audience's context
By focusing only on the Jewish audience
By avoiding certain groups of people
chapter8.correct: By varying his message based on the audience's context

chapter8.question: Which example demonstrates Jesus' crosscultural mission approach?
options: Crossing to the Gentile region of Gadarenes
chapter8.correct: Crossing to the Gentile region of Gadarenes

chapter8.question: What was Jesus' mission in relation to different religious groups?
How did Jesus demonstrate his strategic mission approach?
options: By having a master plan for his mission
chapter8.correct: By having a master plan for his mission

chapter8.question: What illustrates Jesus' strategic rejection of the thirteenth disciple?
options: The healing of the blind man
Sending the healed demoniac back to his people
chapter8.correct: Sending the healed demoniac back to his people

chapter8.question: What structure did Jesus build for his mission?
options: A hierarchical structure based on wealth

chapter8.question: Who were part of Jesus' inner circle within the 12 disciples?
What characterized Jesus' mission as a way of life?
options: It was the reason for his being
chapter8.correct: It was the reason for his being

chapter8.question: What was the focus of Jesus' teachings on the Sermon on the Mount?
What characterized Jesus' response to the physical needs of people?
options: He met their needs to teach spiritual lessons
He delegated them to his disciples
chapter8.correct: He met their needs to teach spiritual lessons

chapter8.question: What was Jesus' eschatological focus in his mission?
options: Focusing on the end times and the kingdom of God
chapter8.correct: Focusing on the end times and the kingdom of God

chapter8.question: What was the central motif of Jesus' preaching according to the text?
options: The reign of God and the kingdom of God
chapter8.correct: The reign of God and the kingdom of God

chapter8.question: How did Jesus' parables serve his mission and teachings?
options: By using ordinary stories to convey profound spiritual truths
By strictly adhering to Jewish traditions
chapter8.correct: By using ordinary stories to convey profound spiritual truths

chapter8.question: What distinguished Jesus' parables from conventional teachings?
options: They were aimed at a specific elite group

chapter8.question: How did Jesus demonstrate authority in his teachings?
options: By speaking on his own authority
By referring to the Roman authorities
chapter8.correct: By speaking on his own authority

chapter8.question: What principle did Ellen G. White emphasize about Jesus' mission method?
What was the first step in Ellen G. White's summary of Jesus' mission methods?
What was the ultimate step in Ellen G. White's summary of Jesus' mission methods?
